page.title: 01WESTWOODSIDE GAZETEER
page.content: Westwoodside is an amalgamation of five previous hamlets and stands in the centre of the triangle of Doncaster, Scunthorpe and Gainsborough The main observation is the continuing change from a purely agricultural community to a mixture of growing suburbia, surrounded by large open tracts of land. The fertile sandy and warp soil produce good crops for farmers and gardeners alike. 25% of the adult population is of retired people and 60% a commuting work force. Agriculture, market gardening and small businesses account for the remaining 15%. For many people, living in the village forms an interim period. The indigenous farming community provides stability in this changeable setting.
